Fascinating battle, due to its location on the border of the Foreign Concessions it essentially turned the fighting into a theatrical event for the European powers.
I'm so in love with this movie. Everything i needed today.

This movie is 100 solid minutes of China and Japan fighting in the the early 1930s. It has bomber raids, beach landings, sword fights, naval bombardments, makeshift last stand fortifications, girl scouts, donation drives and everything you could ever want in a war movie.

A gripping war film about the 1937 defense of a strategically important chokepoint in Shanghai, that features some amazing tracking shots and battle scenes of absolutely epic proportions and in the midst of it all is 23yo Brigitte Lin as the heroic, real life girl scout who helped the Chinese army prevail and saving hundreds of civilians in the process too. The "animated" map just adds to the film's charms and it's not even as crazy patriotic as some more recent mainland productions - it is a Taiwanese production after all.
Salute to Commander Xie and the brave defenders of the 88th Division!
